name: Keeneland Breeze
preparation:
Bourbon and orange don't usually go together, unless it's a slice dropped into an Old Fashioned, but this cocktail adds a splash of orange liqueur to bourbon and tops it off with ginger ale to counter the sweetness.

Fill rocks glass with ice.

Add the bourbon, orange curaçao liqueur and a squeeze of fresh orange and stir.

Top off with ginger ale, and garnish with an orange wedge.
